Package pl.touk.hades

Provides a HA (high-availability) data source.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ConnectionListener  
HadesMBean An interface implemented by Hades that enables jmx access to the data source.
Monitor Each instance of this class monitors both data sources of a hades and can tell if failover should or should not be active for the hades.
 

Class Summary
Hades<M extends Monitor> A data source which offers high-availability (HA) by enclosing two real data sources - the main one and the failover one.
Utils  
 

Exception Summary
Hades.NoMonitorException  
 

Package pl.touk.hades Description

Provides a HA (high-availability) data source. This HA data source contains two other data sources - the main one and the failover one. The high-availability effect is achieved by switching between the two data sources. For example if the main data source breaks, the failover one replaces it until the situation is back to normal.

The process of switching between the two contained data sources is not controlled by the HA data source itself. Implementations of Monitor are responsible for this. Every HA data source is associated with such an implementation which activates failover (switch from the main data source to the failover one) or failback (the opposite switch) when some conditions are met. The conditions may vary between implementations. For example SqlTimeBasedMonitorImpl activates failover when execution time of some sql on the main data source is too big.
